oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Restoration of voting rights of Richard Houston Palmer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Document issued by Tennessee which restored voting rights to Richard Houston Palmer. Palmer served as a private in Co. D, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA in the Army of Northern Virginia. Palmer was paroled on April 9, 1865 at Appomattox Court House, Virginia.; Many former Tennessee Confederate soldiers were disenfranchised in the immediate post-war era. The restoration of voting rights for former Confederates was brought about under the administration of Governor DeWitt Senter from 1867-1871.
